sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the products formed when sodium hydroxide reacts with copper(II) chloride?
message_2:
When sodium hydroxide (NaOH) reacts with copper(II) chloride (CuCl₂), the products formed are copper(II) hydroxide (Cu(OH)₂) and sodium chloride (NaCl). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

2 NaOH + CuCl₂ → Cu(OH)₂ + 2 NaCl
